title: Fact Check: Did Nepal kill seven Indian Army personnel? Here’s the truth | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
Two pictures are being shared on social media with a claim that Indian soldiers violated the ceasefire at India-Nepal border near Belahiya, killing three civilians.

The post also claims that during the firing, Nepal killed seven Indian Army personnel.

“Indian coward Army initiated unprovoked ceasefire violation across the India-Nepal border at Belahiya. At least 3 civilians were injured as a result of unprovoked Indian firing. In responding, Nepal Army killed 7 Indian soldiers,” the post read.

NewsMobile fact-checked the post and found the claim to be false.

We ran a keyword search and found several reports dated June 12, 2020, claiming that one Indian was killed and 2 were injured after Nepal security forces opened fire near Bihar border. Another report can be seen here.

However, we did not find any report to support the claim that 7 Indian soldiers were gunned down by Nepal’s Army.

Taking our investigation further, we then put both the pictures through Reverse Image Search found the following-

We found the first image in an article published by India Today dated April 19, 2010. The same picture was also published in an article by The Hindu. According to the reports, the picture is related to the massacre of 76 security personnel by Naxals in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada district.

We found the second picture in several reports dated June and May 2020, months before the viral tweet surfaced on the internet.

“Soldiers from Nepal’s Armed Police Force patrolling a disputed area along the India-Nepal border. Photo: Rastriya Samachar Samiti, Nepal,” the picture was captioned.

Hence, based on our investigation, we can say that the post in question is FAKE.
